titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: An anthropologist and student of Native American cultures, Elisabeth Tooker (1927-2005) devoted a long career, much of it as a professor at Temple University, to the study of the culture and ethnohistory of the Iroquois Indians of New York State. Tooker received her bachelor's degree from Radcliffe College and did her graduate work at the University of Arizona and Radcliffe, studying the Indians of the American Southwest. She taught at the State University of New York at Buffalo and Mount Holyoke College before joining the faculty of Temple University, where she remained for the rest of her professional career, in 1965. Her publications include An Ethnography of the Huron Indians, 1615-1649 (1964); The Indians of the Northeast: A Critical Bibliography (1978), and Lewis H. Morgan on Iroquois Material Culture (1994).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional papers of Elisabeth Tooker. Materials include: research notes; copies of background articles and manuscripts; bibliographic card files; reprints, journals, and bulletins; lists of books, papers, and artifacts in the Lewis H. Morgan Library; photographs of people, landscapes, artifacts, and ceremonies; microfilm, slides, and sound recordings; and maps. Much of the collection is organized into files by subject, which include Tooker's notes, copies of articles, and relevant correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Donated by Elisabeth Tooker (from MOLE for earlier accession)
Year acquired: 1994 (from MOLE for earlier accession)

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
